intro: Sida dubia var. manresana, commonly known as the Manresana sida, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale pink to white flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
